intro: Chamaelirium japonicum subsp. yakusimense, commonly known as Yakusim Island bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Korean Peninsula and parts of Japan. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky habitats. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
